meanings.definition: To subject (organic matter) to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen, resulting in chemical changes.
meanings.sent1: I will pyrolyze the wood to make charcoal for our barbecue.
meanings.sent2: Scientists pyrolyze biomass to produce biochar for agricultural use.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally pyrolyzed the marshmallows, turning them into crispy treats.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to pyrolyze the metal, transforming it into a molten liquid.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire's heat was so intense that it could pyrolyze entire trees in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The organic waste will pyrolyze in the compost bin over time.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the sample material began to pyrolyze at a specific temperature.
meanings.sent3: The old documents accidentally pyrolyzed in the attic due to the extreme heat.
meanings.sent4: As the temperature rose, the plastic started to pyrolyze, emitting a distinct odor.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scrolls were carefully preserved to prevent them from pyrolyzing in the desert heat.
